refnamediv.refpurpose: Upload a set of files to XML Storage System directory.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This method allows users to upload a set of files. The files will be stored in WebDAV repository and will be accessible via HTTP.

refsect2.title: email
refsect2.para: For user identification, this should be a valid email account.

refsect2.title: password
refsect2.para: The MD5 hash of the password.

refsect2.title: relativepathList
refsect2.para:
Array of strings of target paths relative to the <user home>/blog
folder in WebDAV.

refsect2.title: fileTextList
refsect2.para: An array of strings containing the contents of the files to be uploaded. These must be in the same sequence as the relativepathList. i.e. relativepathList[i] is name for fileTextList[i].

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: This method returns a structure as follows:
refsect1.programlisting: 'flError' boolean 0 success, 1 fault 'message' string fault message (can be used to handle error cases) 'urllist' array of string contains list of URLs corresponding to uploaded files 'yourUpstreamFolderUrl' string base URL for upload

example.title: Using the XML Storage System to Save Multiple Files
example.para: Simple example of saving a file.
example.screen:
- Invocation:
SQL> SOAP_CLIENT (url=>'http://example.com/xmlStorageSystem', operation=>'saveMultipleFiles', parameters=>vector ('email','user@example.domain', 'password', md5('xxx'), 'relativepathList', vector ('test.txt'), 'fileTextList', vector ('this is a test'));
- SOAP Response
<saveMultipleFilesResponse> <Result> <flError>0</flError> <message /> <urllist> <item>http://example.com/DAV/user@example.domain/blog/test.txt</item> </urllist> <yourUpstreamFolderUrl>http://example.com/DAV/user@example.domain/blog/</yourUpstreamFolderUrl> </Result> </saveMultipleFilesResponse>
